content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a risk-averse undergraduate student who values security and certainty in all aspects of life, I would choose the strategy that provides a consistent payoff with minimal loss.

In this game, choosing 'R' results in higher earnings (45$) when my opponent also chooses 'R', but it also results in no earnings when my opponent chooses 'B'. On the other hand, choosing 'B' yields 12$ consistently regardless of my opponent's choice. Since my goal is to minimize risk and maximize security, I would opt for the 'B' strategy. This way, I am assured of earning at least some money in each round.

Moreover, since the game has 75 rounds, even though choosing 'B' may seem less profitable per round compared to 'R', over the long run, it is more beneficial due to its consistency. In the end, my choice would be {'B'}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.

Since both of us chose 'B' in the previous round, we each received a payoff of 12$. In the next round, I will stick with my risk-averse strategy and choose 'B' again, hoping to maintain this consistent payoff. {'B'}

If I observe that my opponent starts changing their strategy from 'B' to 'R', I might start questioning whether they are trying to maximize their earnings or if there is some other motive at play, and I would then reconsider my own strategy. But for now, given my preference for security and consistency, I will stick with the 'B' choice.

For now, however, I will maintain my consistent 'B' strategy.
